definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
good-looking/charming/(of goods) in great demand/(coll.) to season (food)

sentences.english: These patricians don’t need gaudy symbols to advertise their wealth.
sentences.chinese: 這羣貴族並不需要花俏的商標來炫耀他們的財富。

sentences.english: Hit the road in this sporty green street machine with opening doors.
sentences.chinese: 打開車門，讓此款花俏的綠色道路機器衝向道路中。

sentences.english: No fads, fillers, or anything artificial.
sentences.chinese: 沒有花俏和添加劑，沒有任何人爲的東西。

sentences.english: Both of them like fancy clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他倆都喜歡穿花俏別緻的服裝。

sentences.english: The poster has a very elaborate border.
sentences.chinese: 這張海報有着非常花俏的圖框。

sentences.english: BWhy do people like all this fancy, expensive underwear?
sentences.chinese: 人們爲何喜歡這些又花俏又貴的內衣？

sentences.english: She wants to buy a handbag,not fancy but strong/durable.
sentences.chinese: 她想買一個手提包不要花俏，而要耐用。

sentences.english: That is a fancy way of saying sound waves were transmitted.
sentences.chinese: 這是說明傳播聲波的一種花俏說法。

sentences.english: This game includes plenty of new bells and whistles to keep any PC gamer intrigued.
sentences.chinese: 此遊戲有很多的新的花俏保留任何電腦遊戲感興趣。

sentences.english: Write simple sentences. Avoid a fancy style.
sentences.chinese: 嘗試簡單句，避免花俏的句法。

sentences.english: I like those fancy goods very much.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡那些花俏的商品很多。

sentences.english: Why do people like all this fancy, expensive underwear?
sentences.chinese: 人們爲何喜歡這些又花俏又貴的內衣？

definition: (of speech or actions) direct and efficient/without fooling around
flower but no fruit (idiom); handsome exterior but hollow inside/flashy
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
